main event: A civilian observed a quarter-bright red unidentified object with varying shape hover in St. Louis, Missouri, on July 19, 20, and 21, 1963.
interesting points: The object was first seen at a high altitude and hovered for an extended period before moving backward for 40 seconds., Witness described the object as reflecting sunlight and making a slight humming noise., The sighting included sketches showing the object's position above the horizon., Witness estimated the object's speed to be around 1,000 mph and distance approximately 1,000 feet., The object was classified as 'Unidentified' due to insufficient data and the possibility of hovering behavior.
witness description: A female, 29 years old, college graduate.
